file_content.text: Hi. Sorry to interrupt. My name's Fauler--I was told you might be passing through.
I represent the Republic here. Since we don't get many Jedi, I thought we could meet. I think we should talk. Get my meaning?
I'm a little confused, to be honest. Why do you want to talk to a Jedi?
I'm not sure.
I represent the Republic here, and I thought we could chat. I thought the military might lend me a hand--unofficially, anyway.
If you're a Republic representative, sir, why would it be unofficial?
Unofficially?
I represent the Republic here, but I keep my ear to the ground. I've heard things about you, and I'd like to chat. Get my meaning?
Look, Fauler--I promise, I'm just here to do business.
I'm not here to cause trouble.
Hey, buddy, I'm not looking to bother you. I just want to meet.
I represent the Republic here, and I'd like to chat. Get my meaning?
Honestly, I'm a little confused. How'd you even find me?
I'm not sure.
All right.
If you want to talk, talk.
So? Keep going.
Here's the thing--I'd rather not do this by holocommunicator.
I've got a little, ah, embassy in downtown Anchorhead. Swing on by. I promise you it's worthwhile.
You're playing it awfully vague.
Why the secrecy?
Maybe.
Good to hear it. The sooner, the better. This is much bigger than some local trouble.
Does that mean there's money involved?
Worthwhile, huh?
There's money involved--and there's an awful lot at stake. That's about all I can say.
A promise from a stranger isn't worth much.
That doesn't really help.
Come on, you're hurting me.
Look, if you're not interested, I'm not gonna force you. But this isn't some local trouble. This is bigger.
Fauler out.
